definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: Their gonads were normal, as were their hearts.
sentences.chinese: 它們的生殖腺和心臟依舊正常。

sentences.english: There were some differences in the change of fat body coefficient and genital gland coefficient of the two sexes.
sentences.chinese: 脂肪體系數和生殖腺係數的變化均表現兩性差異。

sentences.english: After awhile, sometimes all that remains of the male are his gonads.
sentences.chinese: 一段時間以後，雄魚便會解體得只剩下生殖腺。

sentences.english: In heavy infestations, the gonad was completely destroyed and replaced by mass of larval treamatodes.
sentences.chinese: 嚴重感染的宿主，生殖腺完全被侵佔並耗盡。

sentences.english: The gonads open near the base of the abdomen and the excretory organs are usually Malpighian tubules.
sentences.chinese: 生殖腺開口於近腹部基部，排泄器官通常爲馬氏管。

sentences.english: The gonads are the follicular style and are composed of germ cells and nutrition cells.
sentences.chinese: 生殖腺爲濾泡型，由營養細胞和生殖細胞共同構成。

sentences.english: The glands of reproduction are the reservoirs of the life force.
sentences.chinese: 生殖腺是生命力的庫藏。

sentences.english: This doctor is experienced in treating gonad diseases.
sentences.chinese: 這位醫生對治療生殖腺疾病非常有經驗。

sentences.english: Amphioxus the male and female body shape of the same, but different gonad.
sentences.chinese: 文昌魚的雌體與雄體外形相同，但生殖腺不同。

definition: endocrine gland/gland producing internal secretion, e.g. hormone
